name: io/http/express/GET handler

e9bc1352-a18d-4f1c-9e71-f6eabbc998e9.name: app ID
e9bc1352-a18d-4f1c-9e71-f6eabbc998e9.description:
The id of the express instance.

Example: 
"my-express-server"

f532eb6f-572b-41fd-bcc9-b010f9149040.name: route
f532eb6f-572b-41fd-bcc9-b010f9149040.description:
Receives the route(s) to handle requests for. Route be specified as exact match (1) or as pattern match (2).

Example:
1) "/status" will just match "/status"
2) "/s*s" will match "status", "shoes", etc..

7e29d4cd-7483-448f-8fdf-f27115cc7282.name: status
7e29d4cd-7483-448f-8fdf-f27115cc7282.description:
Receives the HTTP status code to be sent with the response to the client.

Example: 
200

37b7a26d-a795-4792-bebf-b450dd99b68e.name: headers

7ce0b818-efee-4b40-a57e-b271b39d1735.name: body
7ce0b818-efee-4b40-a57e-b271b39d1735.description:
Receives the content to send to the client as response body.

Example:
- "OK"
- 3.14
- { "status": "OK" }

92623fb2-b7f4-4412-b3b6-9c357f615e17.name: headers

f0395ca1-8098-4603-ba0b-2f8c262d865a.name: query
f0395ca1-8098-4603-ba0b-2f8c262d865a.description: Forwards the query parameters to process.

a217c84c-45ba-46aa-b4b7-cb4e0e43cdd3.name: done
a217c84c-45ba-46aa-b4b7-cb4e0e43cdd3.description: Event triggered when the request has been processed.

description:
Receives GET requests on the specified route and dispatches the corresponding response.

Example:
1. "my-express-server"@0 received on `app ID`
2. "/status/"@0 received on `route`
3. a client GET request received by express with URL "http://api.mydomain.com/status?q=1&p=2"
4. the following signals are sent to other node(s) processing the request
- {
 "accept": "application/json"
}@0 sent on `headers`
- { "q": "1", "p": "2" }@0 sent `query`
5. The following signals are received back from processing nodes and sent out to the client:
- 200@0 on `status`,
- {
    "content-type": "application/json" 
  }@0 on `headers`,
- { status: "OK" }@0 on `body`
7. null@0 sent on `done`
